the addition of the melee system with dual weapons is a game changer, giving you a strong backup for when you get swamped. And of course the hundreds of zombies on screen at once is still the most impressive technical and emotional draw.
its a high quality package that continually gets supported. of you have a dedicated squad, this is one of the best co-op experiences you can buy on steam.

This game is kinda a mixed a bag. It's overall a good game, the visuals are stunning and captures the World War Z premise pretty well with all those waves of running zombies, but it has it's fair share of bugs and design flaws.

What I hate the most is the invisible dmg trail that happens before you get overrun by zombies. It's just an invisible trigger block of heavy dmg that gets turned on when x zombies are breaking through certain defenses.

The bots teammates in this game will never reach the level of L4D. They are incredibly dumb and do only the minimum to survive. It's a pain in the butt to keep them alive on harder difficulties.

There is also a bunch of controversy like First Person being paywalled and how easy it is to obtain lvl 999 through obtaining modified save data.

If you plan to 100% this game then good luck with the dead multiplayer mode where the games offers a bunch of gamemodes focusing on team fights. You have to gather a bunch of people for that alone which req. time and patience.

Ok, not everything is bad. They did a good job on the replayability of this game though with all those level-up systems with your weapons or your class and daily/weekly challenges. It is very grindy to max out everything, just enjoy the process and do it at your own pace so you don't get burned out.

[h3] Relaxing shoot 'em up, but a bit too repetitive. [/h3]


[h1] Gameplay: [/h1]
I give this game a positive review for its gameplay, content, playable characters, and weapons.
However, the campaign is too short, and so much areas are in DLC too much expensive.
This game is not a cash grab, though.

The difficulty level ranges from very easy to incredibly hard.
The gameplay is really focused on the horde style, even the campaign, with each map's areas designed in horde style.
There are many shoot 'em up games, and this one offers some really good ones.

[h1] Graphic design: [/h1]
The graphics are beautiful, the maps are amazing, it's sad that the developers didn't choose to make more use of them.
The graphics could have been a little goreier, with more blood and more zombie body parts—that's always welcome in shoot 'em up games.

[h1] Playtime: [/h1]
We can raise our personal level very high; I've seen players above level 500, but the lack of maps makes this game quickly repetitive and clearly reduces its playtime.


[h3] A good game, not too expensive but with a lot of DLC content. The developers didn't know how to exploit their creation as it deserves. [/h3]

THIS IS THE MOST UNDERRATED GAME I'VE PLAYED.

There I've said. Seriously. I cannot comprehend why this game is so f***ing overlooked. Maybe because it uses a bad movie title? But really, it should be considered just a standalone game on its own because that's exactly what it is.
There's only 5 words to aptly describe this game:

[b]Left 4 Dead on Steroids[/b]

Amongst all the insane number of zombie games out there, it's even more insane there's SO FEW ones that actually lets you experience simply full-on action instead of some survival hardcore premise. WWZ is like that successor to L4D2 we always wanted but never could have since Valve can't count to f****ing 3.  It's also a hell lot better than Back 4 Blood in just doing its own thing and with far better campaigns and zombie gore.

Even though the zombie genre isn't new, WWZ has stood out with its absolute anarchy in letting loose as many freaking zombies as it can fit through your computer screen.  You can think of it like that Israel scene in the WWZ movie but adapted as a video game. Insanely fast moving zombies and such a s****t ton of them they form mountains atop each other... yeah... that's the kind of zombie fun I missed for too long. WWZ takes place in this unique timeline as well, where humanity is not all lost and still actively fighting the zombies. This explains all the military hardware available to you including airstrikes, mortars, machineguns and freaking rocket launchers.

The action is loud and fun and there's never much of a moment for a breather aside from the very start of the level. Zombies come at you from all directions during horde events and the amount of zombies you see charging at you from a distance is just breathtaking. Like seriously. This game can somehow fit thousands of zombies on screen at once... it's impressive. Sometimes I wonder how I even am able to kill these tens of thousands of zombies to begin with.

The campaign levels are also like L4D2 and incredibly solid... in fact, I'd say more than solid. It's liquid! What I mean by that is there's a shit ton of variety in each level, even with the same game mechanics persisting. True to its name, each level takes place in a completely different location and spans across multiple countries around the globe, something no other zombie game dares to do. You get to experience the tropics of South America, the cold winter in Russia, the city hellscape in the US and Japan and so on... 

This splice of variety is incredibly refreshing as it takes across various places. The campaign flow is also incredibly varied as it's not just about running from point A to point B saferooms blindly like in L4D2. There are various objectives you must complete in each level and some aren't that straight forward, like one level set in winter where you need constantly activate heaters and memorize a small puzzle of order of switches to pull.
At the end of it all, each point in the campaign requires you to set up defenses to get ready for a king of the hill kind of battle against the bazillions of zombie hordes and even though it's basically the same thing every time, the killing of zombies never really gets old. The enemy variety is also incredibly diverse and even though I admit I dont really pay attention to each zombie, I never really felt like I was killing the same zombie twice the whole time despite the sheer amount of spawns.

I think the only slight flaws of the game is 
1. The zombie gore which doesn't rival that of being as intricate as L4D2's. Nevertheless the gore is complex enough and impressive given how many damn zombies the game spawns at any one time. You can blow off their legs, limbs and heads which is heaps above the static crap fest that Back 4 Blood gave for their zombies.
2. The AI bots can be abit dumb at times but by that I do mean... rarely. I've only had one instance where the AI bots failed me when I was being attacked by a hunter (or whatever zombie you call that) which pounced at me while the rest of bots didnt bother saving my ass. Apart from that, they're smart enough to stick close to you and are actually pretty on par with how you'd expect those same bots to act in L4D2. The AI bots are also programmed to do stealth kills if you're in stealth mode, which is really nice.

WWZ does improve on L4D2 at least, especially in terms of progression. Whereas L4D2 had no progression system at all which made playing the game eventually meaningless, WWZ keeps things fresh by letting you upgrade your weapons and explore multiple different character classes, all with their own unique abilities and weapon specialisations. One class lets you deploy a drone while another lets you just go berserk on weapons for example.

Overall, WWZ is a wonderful game and sadly quite underrated since it borrows the title of that movie which was heavily criticised for not being faithful to the book. I think the concept of exploring zombie battles around the world cannot be understated however and it's so great to see this game bring that concept to live finally.

Score: 5/5

I like it the games entertaining and runs fine on a 5060ti but putting the first person view mode behind a FUCKING PAYWALL is unacceptable.

This game has like 50 characters and not a single one of them is memorable. They just say the same one liners every 30 seconds with zero variety. 
The desync with hordes is actually horrendous. I've seen my teammates shooting at zombies and they would not die, and also they melee zombies that are on their screen but not mine. So I'm over here wondering if the zombies I'm shooting are actually real zombies. Zombie schizophrenia. 
The music is also terrible and not memorable at all. 
The only thing going for this game is the massive hordes that appear but thats about it.

Unfortunately, Horde Mode XL is broken, at least on Tokyo. I’m surprised this is even in the game, as it happens consistently and not at random. On round 26, when rotating to the construction site, the timer will disappear and ultimately soft-lock the game. Objectives are also super buggy, sometimes loading 2 at a time and once again soft locking the game. Theres also an issue of players getting kicked mid-game, but "thankfully" you can join back.

It's a good game on console, but the PC port has a lot of optimization issues and struggles with all 3 of my PC's ranging from mid-high to high end builds. Can't seem to get rid of the FPS stuttering and lag. In a game like this its vital, you lose track of nearby enemies even for a second and they teleport onto you when you stutter thats game over on harder difficulties.

I really would want to like this game but it's just does not give me anything to hook onto.

Before I start this, I adore this game. I've played multiple days worth on xbox. Since I no longer have my xbox I decided to get it on here to try to play with my friends. Turns out... even through my PC specs are better than the minimum AND recommended specs it is unplayable. My screen is flashing the whole time (Assets just flicking constanstantly). Turns out, on my specific graphics card the game has issues. I hate that I can't play the game... because I love this game. If you have a major issue like this on a common graphics card you should state it. The community has made their own work arounds for the issue but if you download the 'fix' you can no longer play it online. Which is understandable, however this 'fix', and the associated issue has existed for more than 8 months. Idk, I expected better and I would generally recommend the game but with this big issue not getting fixed I can't in good conscious recommend it on PC.

While the game is a good time waster when you have 15 - 30 minutes to kill on some levels, there's been an increasing number of bad decisions on the devs part. 

If you want a coop game where everybody and their mother DOESN'T use exploits constantly, look elsewhere or play solo, because they are everywhere thanks to that dumb sword. 

The most recently released primary weapon, which it's been a few months, takes what seems to be THREE head shots PER basic zeke to kill it, when every other weapon takes one. That means even the basic pistol is stronger than a tier 2 primary weapon.

The addition of rats as an enemy had given the devs a good bit of flak for an enemy that not only made no sense, but was just irritating to deal with. The solution? leave the rats in and add an enemy that's resistant/immune to crowd control, and acts almost identical to the bull.

All and all, if you want the game, I strongly recommend waiting for a sale, because the devs clearly don't play their own game to see if the additions are fun or not.

While the game is a good time waster when you have 15 - 30 minutes to kill on some levels, there's been an increasing number of bad decisions on the devs part. 

If you want a coop game where everybody and their mother DOESN'T use exploits constantly, look elsewhere or play solo, because they are everywhere thanks to that dumb sword. 

The most recently released primary weapon, which it's been a few months, takes what seems to be THREE head shots PER basic zeke to kill it, when every other weapon takes one. That means even the basic pistol is stronger than a tier 2 primary weapon.

The addition of rats as an enemy had given the devs a good bit of flak for an enemy that not only made no sense, but was just irritating to deal with. The solution? leave the rats in and add an enemy that's resistant/immune to crowd control, and acts almost identical to the bull.

All and all, if you want the game, I strongly recommend waiting for a sale, because the devs clearly don't play their own game to see if the additions are fun or not.
